TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable beforefieldinit TaskType extends ExchangeWebServices.ItemType

Docs.summary: The class represents a task in the Exchange store.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: The constructor initializes a new instance of the class.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property int ActualWork { int get(); void set(int value); };

Docs.summary: The property gets or sets an integer value that specifies the actual amount of time that is spent on a task.
Docs.value: The property returns an integer value that specifies the actual amount of time that is spent on a task.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool ActualWorkSpecified { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: The property gets or sets a Boolean value that specifies whether the property is serialized into the SOAP request. This property is required if the property is specified.
Docs.value: The property returns true if the property is serialized into the SOAP request; otherwise, the property returns false.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property DateTime AssignedTime { DateTime get(); void set(DateTime value); };

Docs.summary: The property gets or sets an instance of the DateTime structure that contains the time when a task is assigned to a contact.
Docs.value: The property returns an instance of the DateTime structure that contains the time when a task is assigned to a contact.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool AssignedTimeSpecified { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: The property gets or sets a Boolean value that specifies whether the property is serialized into the SOAP request. This property is required if the property is specified.
Docs.value: The property returns true if the property is serialized into the SOAP request; otherwise, the property returns false.

Docs.summary: The property gets or sets a string value that contains billing information for a task.
Docs.value: The property returns a string value that contains billing information for a task.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property int ChangeCount { int get(); void set(int value); };

Docs.summary: The property gets or sets an integer value that specifies the version of a task.
Docs.value: The property returns an integer value that specifies the version of a task.

Docs.summary: The property gets or sets a Boolean value that specifies whether the property is serialized into the SOAP request. This property is required if the property is specified.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property cli::array <System::String ^> ^ Companies { cli::array <System::String ^> ^ get(); void set(cli::array <System::String ^> ^ value); };

Docs.summary: The property gets or sets an instance of an array of type string that represents a collection of companies that are associated with a task.
Docs.value: The property returns an array of type string that represents a collection of companies that are associated with a task.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property DateTime CompleteDate { DateTime get(); void set(DateTime value); };

Docs.summary: The property gets or sets an instance of the DateTime structure that represents the date on which a task was completed.
Docs.value: The property returns an instance of the DateTime structure that represents the date on which a task was completed.

remarks.para: Setting the property has the same effect as setting the property to 100 or the property to . In a request that sets at least two of these properties, the last processed property will determine the value that is set for these elements. For example, if the property is 100, the property is January 1, 2007, and the property is , and the properties are streamed in that order, the effect will be to set the property of the task to , the property to a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic), and the property to 0.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool CompleteDateSpecified { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: The property gets or sets a Boolean value that specifies whether the property is serialized into the SOAP request. This property is required if the property is specified.
Docs.value: The property returns true if the property is serialized into the SOAP request; otherwise, the property returns false.

Docs.summary: The property gets or sets an instance of an array of type string that contains a list of contacts that are associated with a task.
Docs.value: The property returns an array of type string that contains a list of contacts that are associated with a task.

Docs.value: The property returns an instance of the DateTime structure that represents the date when the task is due.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property int IsAssignmentEditable { int get(); void set(int value); };

Docs.summary: The property gets or sets an integer value that represents the task type.
Docs.value: The property returns an integer value that represents the task type.

remarks.para: The following table lists possible values for the property.

item.description: The default for all task items.
A task acceptance from a recipient of a task.
A task declination from a recipient of a task.
An update to a previous task request.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool IsAssignmentEditableSpecified { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.value: The property returns true if the property is serialized into the SOAP request; otherwise, the property returns false.

Docs.value: The property returns true if the task has been completed; otherwise, the property returns false.

Docs.value: The property returns true if the task is part of a recurring task; otherwise, the property returns false.

Docs.value: The property returns a string value that represents the owner of the task.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property double PercentComplete { double get(); void set(double value); };

Docs.summary: The property gets or sets a double value from 0 to 100 that describes the completion status of a task.
Docs.value: The property returns a double value from 0 to 100 that describes the completion status of a task.

remarks.para: Setting the property has the same effect as setting the property to 100 or the property to . In a request that sets at least two of these properties, the last processed property will determine the value that is set for these elements. For example, if the property is 100, the property is January 1, 2007, and the property is , and the properties are streamed in that order, the effect will be to set the property of the task to , the property to a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic), and the property to 0.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool PercentCompleteSpecified { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: The property gets or sets a Boolean value that specifies whether the property is serialized into the SOAP request. This property is required if the property is specified.
Docs.value: The property returns true if the property is serialized into the SOAP request; otherwise, the property returns false.

Docs.value: The property returns an instance of the class that contains recurrence information for a recurring task.

remarks.para: Setting the property has the same effect as setting the property to 100 or the property to .
